meta.project: Richard Kwame Asomaning Jr. — Data Science Portfolio

product_overview: A single-page personal portfolio website for Richard Kwame Asomaning Jr. that showcases data science projects, technical skills, and experience while providing a contact form and social links for recruiters and collaborators.
core_goals: Showcase featured data science projects with links to demos/repos
Highlight technical skills across analysis, ML, visualization, programming, and tooling
Present education and professional experience in a clear visual timeline
Provide an accessible, responsive contact channel for recruiters and collaborators
Deliver a polished, modern design with smooth-scrolling navigation and micro-interactions

features.name: Navigation
features.description: Sticky top navigation with smooth-scrolling anchor links, active-section highlighting, and a mobile hamburger menu for small viewports.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Click on Projects link -> See Projects section scrolled into view -> Navbar highlights Projects link
Navigate to / -> Click on About link -> Smooth scrolling fails (JS disabled) -> Browser jumps to anchor without animation -> Navbar highlight does not update

features.name: Hero Section
features.description: Full-screen landing area introducing the owner with animated background, availability badge, and a CTA button that scrolls to Projects.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> View introduction -> Click View My Projects button -> See Projects section scrolled into view
Navigate to / -> View introduction -> Click View My Projects button -> CTA is unresponsive (JS error) -> No scrolling occurs

features.name: About Section
features.description: Personal bio, photo placeholder with accent glow, and a horizontally scrolling tech-stack badge display to communicate background and tools.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Scroll to About section -> See personal bio and photo area -> View tech stack badges
Navigate to / -> Scroll to About section -> Tech badge images fail to load -> See placeholders for badges

features.name: Projects Section
features.description: Card-based grid showcasing featured data science projects with gradient thumbnails, tags, and 'View Project' links that open demos/repos in new tabs.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Scroll to Projects section -> Hover over project card -> Click View Project link -> New tab opens with project demo or repo
Navigate to / -> Scroll to Projects section -> Click View Project link -> New tab blocked by browser popup blocker -> See instruction to allow popups

features.name: Skills Section
features.description: Five category cards that group and list specific skills across Data Analysis, Machine Learning, Visualization, Programming, and Tools & Platforms.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Scroll to Skills section -> See five category cards -> Read list of skills under a category
Navigate to / -> Scroll to Skills section -> On narrow viewport cards stack and overflow -> See truncated text or clipped content

features.name: Experience / Timeline
features.description: Vertical timeline showing education and work milestones with connecting line and dot markers for easy scanning of chronology and details.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Scroll to Experience section -> See vertical timeline with connecting line and markers -> Read details for an entry
Navigate to / -> Scroll to Experience section -> Timeline entries overlap on very small screens -> See visual overlap and potential unreadable text

features.name: Contact Section (Info Panel & Contact Form)
features.description: Split layout containing an info panel with social links and a contact form (Name, Email, Message) with client-side validation and an external POST submission. On successful submit the button displays '✓ Message Sent!' for 3 seconds.
user_flows: Navigate to / -> Scroll to Contact section -> Fill Name input field -> Fill email input field -> Fill message input field -> Click Submit button -> POST to (external) succeeds -> See button text change to '✓ Message Sent!' for 3 seconds -> Form fields clear

Navigate to / -> Scroll to Contact section -> Fill Name input field -> Fill email input field with invalid email -> Fill message input field -> Click Submit button -> See inline validation error for email -> Submission prevented

Navigate to / -> Scroll to Contact section -> Fill Name input field -> Fill email input field -> Fill message input field -> Click Submit button -> POST to (external) fails (network or server error) -> See error message and original input preserved

features.name: Navigation
features.description: Navbar links to scroll to sections
